body_content.explanation: able to be reached or easily obtained :
examples: The resort is easily accessible by road, rail, and air.
The building has fast internet accessible to subscribers.
The problem with some of these drugs is that they are so very accessible.

body_content.explanation: able to be entered or used by everyone, including people who use a wheelchair, people who are blind, etc.:
examples: They agreed to build more affordable and accessible housing.
All the toilets are fully accessible.
Lea Anderson is a choreographer who believes in making dance accessible.
Covent Garden has made some attempt to make opera accessible to a wider public.

body_content.explanation: used at the end of words to mean that something can be reached or obtained in a particular way or by a particular group of people:
examples: The facility is handicapped-accesible, with a ramp leading to the entrance.
The stadium currently has 90 wheelchair-accessible seats.
Computer-accessible medical records avoid paper waste and save time.
The device has two front-accessible USB ports.
